article:
'REACT' began as a CB radio Emergency Channel 9 monitoring organization across
the United States and Canada in 1962. Initially, the primary role of REACT
volunteers was to monitor Channel 9, the CB Emergency Channel, to help
motorists. Later, duties grew to include communications after disasters
(tornadoes, floods...), and in some places before disasters (storm spotting). As
well, REACT safety communications for parades, runs/walks and other community
events became prominent. Although some REACT Teams still use CB primarily, a
large percentage have now added amateur, FRS, GMRS, Multi-Use Radio Service
(MURS), Trunked radio systems and business band radio (LMR) to their public
service capabilities.
